lines.text: Soon as I saw you, I said to myself, that's a hot lookin' little number.
Don't let it throw ya champ. I'm 20 degrees cooler than you think.
Ah, one of them refrigerated dames, huh?
That's right. You're not the guy to defrost me either.
Mr. Ziegfeld says, if I don't watch my figure, no one else will.
Cucaracha, look at that one! She looks better all wrapped up than the rest of them do unwrapped.
Are you making a pass at me?
It appears that I am, Sheila.
A forward pass?
Very forward. Well... do I complete it?
Nobody's blocking you.
Remember, a pretty good moon, you let me kiss you after only slapping me twice.
Three times.
Okay, three.
And then I told you you'll do for me, and I'll do for you.
I have no uncle, and he doesn't live in Philadelphia.
You know, I think I'll adopt a baby. A boy, about 21.
I hope I didn't raise my son to be a Ziegfeld Girl too.

[to Geoffrey Collis]
I get a bang out of you and you get a bang out of me.

[to Franz]
It's a disgrace to your violin to make jazz music.
Gil, I'm in it now. I'm a Ziegfeld girl.
You sound like a bottle of milk that just got certified.
Aw, Gil don't spoil things. I just got to see it through, don't I? What do I tell our grandkids if I don't?
Dames is just like traffic. Sometimes you gotta stop, sometimes you gotta go.
[heads toward the door to leave]
Yeah but a smart driver don't beat the lights.

[Gil kisses her hard]
Ok... so you know your own strength
You ain't exactly anemic yourself.
Oh love! There's that silly word again! Gee, Sandra, why can't the men you want have the things you want?
Did you really imagine I would stand by while you showed yourself to other men?
